ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
I learned about the foundational theories guiding feminist science and technology studies, and how these theories are related to other fields including queer studies, disability studies, black feminist thought, and general STS. 
I learned how to think about frameworks for analysis, apply those frameworks to examples in the real world, and also think about ways that frameworks intersect or oppose each other.
This course helped me completely re-evaluate my major. phenomenal class for STEM students especially but just as illuminating for non-stem people as well. 10000% recommend
I learned to question science as it is taught, and understood by the mainstream.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I thought this course was amazing and I really appreciated all of the student input in co-creating expectations for the class and the assignments. I loved the reading selections and the opportunities to also engage with film/media. I would have loved to read more on the technology side as I felt like a lot of our readings were centered around biology, but I still thought it was a great selection and we had a lot of good conversations.
I especially appreciated when we got to work in pairs or small groups to discuss first because I felt like it gave more room to talk. Sometimes we weren't able to finish everything in a class session because student presentations ran long, so perhaps presentations could be more focused on facilitating discussion rather than just summary of the chapters.
this class was amazing! Prof Valdez was incredibly thoughtful and insightful and was so committed to making sure the course was tailored to the students' learning objectives.

strengths of the course are engaging readings, small classroom size which enabled us to have a good relationship with each other and with professor (we had two parties as a class) and the fact that professor Valdez is so knowledgeable on the subject and very kind as a person. our classroom was definitely a safe space for all of us, and we learned so much over the course of the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes I would recommend this course to anyone who is curious about looking at a feminist approach to STEM.

This is by far the best class and professor I have had at Yale so far. Student thoughts and needs are taken very seriously by professor Valdez and discussions are always inclusive and intellectually stimulating. Assignments are thoughtful and fair with very helpful feedback. Cannot express how much I felt seen, heard, and appreciated in this class and would absolutely recommend this course to any student interested in learning more about feminist thought and practices.

ABSOLUTELY!!! This was truly one of the best classes I've ever taken. I learned so much and I would recommend this course to literally anyone regardless of major. i could not recommend it more highly.

yes, I would definitely recommend this class to any student, but only students who are willing to challenge their own thinking and be very vulnerable in a classroom environment and also students willing to engage with sometimes difficult course material and treat all subjects with grace.
